Paris Exposition: Esplanade des Invalides, Paris, France, 1900

Paris Exposition: Inauguration Day, Paris, France, 1900. Inauguration Day. The 'Ship of the President' or the President's Barge. President Loubet and his party embark to review the foreign pavilion and Pont Alexandre III after opening excercises. The buildings belonging to the Trocadero section are visible. The Palace of Animated Voyages with its circular balcony is clearly seen in the center. Brooklyn Museum Archives, <a href"http:www.brooklynmuseum.orgresearchdigital-collectionsgoodyear" rel"nofollow">Goodyear Archival Collection<a> (S03_06_01_014 image 9892). It helps us to know how our visitors work with our images, so if you use it, we'd love to know how! Drop us a line by leaving a comment here or email our archivist: library@brooklynmuseum.org

Paris Exposition: Inauguration Day, Paris, France, 1900

Paris Exposition: Seine River, Paris, France, 1900. The Seine from the Alexandre III bridge. In view is the Bridge of the Invalides as well as the Pavilion of the City of Paris on the right and the Italian Pavilion on the right. Brooklyn Museum Archives, <a href"http:www.brooklynmuseum.orgresearchdigital-collectionsgoodyear" rel"nofollow">Goodyear Archival Collection<a> (S03_06_01_015 image 2048).
